benchmark_details.name: NoisyAG-News
benchmark_details.overview: NoisyAG-News is a new benchmark dataset constructed to evaluate the effectiveness of learning methods from instance-dependent label noise in text classification. It provides 50,000 samples with human annotations to capture real-world label noise patterns, enriching the research landscape on noisy label learning within the NLP domain.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate the development and evaluation of future solutions for learning with noisy labels in text classification tasks, particularly addressing instance-dependent noise.

data.source: The dataset is derived from AG-News and constructed through crowdsourced redundant label sets, involving manual annotation by 60 annotators.

methodology.calculation: The performance is calculated based on the accuracy of models when evaluated on the NoisyAG-News dataset and compared against synthetic noise datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better robustness and understanding of noisy labels, with specific attention to instance-dependent noise.
methodology.validation: The dataset's validation involves statistical comparisons of model performances on varying noise-induced datasets.
